headline: Sources and acknowledgments

children.data: As well as those named in this report, the author wishes to thank: Janusz Bialek, Jocelyn Chang, Mikey Clark, Julie Cohn, Danielle Dominey-Kent, Per Falborg, Will Gardiner, Connor Gary, Richard Hanson, Devin Hartman, Bruce Heppenstall, Christina Huemmer, Mike James, Suriya Jayanti, Fahimeh Kazempour, Aidan Kerr, Daniel Kirschen, Sara Revell, Rebecca Sedler and Solveig Wright
When the Grid Was the Grid: The History of North America’s Brief Coast-to-Coast Interconnected Machine
IGBT: From Invention and Commercialisation to Global Social Impact
The Indian Ministry of Power annual report is a fascinating picture of a grid in an incredible state of flux
Amprion’s report for 2022 shows a developed country’s grid
Achieving a 100% Renewable Grid: Operating Electric Power Systems with Extremely High Levels of Variable Renewable Energy

bodyText:
As well as those named in this report, the author wishes to thank: Janusz Bialek, Jocelyn Chang, Mikey Clark, Julie Cohn, Danielle Dominey-Kent, Per Falborg, Will Gardiner, Connor Gary, Richard Hanson, Devin Hartman, Bruce Heppenstall, Christina Huemmer, Mike James, Suriya Jayanti, Fahimeh Kazempour, Aidan Kerr, Daniel Kirschen, Sara Revell, Rebecca Sedler and Solveig Wright
Read/watch list:
When the Grid Was the Grid: The History of North America’s Brief Coast-to-Coast Interconnected Machine (Julie Cohn)  
IGBT: From Invention and Commercialisation to Global Social Impact (Jayant Baliga)
The Indian Ministry of Power annual report is a fascinating picture of a grid in an incredible state of flux  
Amprion’s report for 2022 shows a developed country’s grid 
Mesoscale modelling of a “Dunkelflaute” event 
Achieving a 100% Renewable Grid: Operating Electric Power Systems with Extremely High Levels of Variable Renewable Energy

parts.headline: The ultimate supply chains
parts.description: One of the foundations of modernity is about to be transformed, reports Hal Hodson

parts.headline: Sources and acknowledgments
The electric grid is about to be transformed
parts.description: The technological and regulatory requirements will be immense, writes Hal Hodson

parts.headline: Adding capacity to the electricity grid is not a simple task
parts.description: It is even more difficult if the power comes from renewable sources

parts.headline: Electric grids fed by renewables need a different kind of plumbing
parts.description: And a whole different kind of switch

publication.headline: The ultimate supply chains
publication.description: One of the foundations of modernity is about to be transformed, reports Hal Hodson

parts.headline: The electric grid is about to be transformed
parts.description: The technological and regulatory requirements will be immense, writes Hal Hodson

parts.headline: Adding capacity to the electricity grid is not a simple task
parts.description: It is even more difficult if the power comes from renewable sources

parts.headline: Electric grids fed by renewables need a different kind of plumbing
parts.description: And a whole different kind of switch

parts.headline: It is harder for new electric grids to balance supply and demand
parts.description: The sun does not always shine

parts.headline: The physics of rotating masses can no longer define the electric grid
parts.description: That will make it better in the long run

parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: The case for an environmentalism that builds
parts.description: Economic growth should help, not hinder, the fight against climate change

parts.headline: What America has got wrong about gender medicine
parts.description: Too many doctors have suspended their professional judgment

parts.description: Britain’s principles for cyberwarfare are a good start

parts.headline: What America’s friends should make of The Trump Show
parts.description: Reasons to be both relaxed and worried

parts.headline: How to fix the International Monetary Fund
parts.description: The fund must get tough on obstructive creditors, but save them a seat at the table

parts.headline: The university lottery
parts.description: Students are veering away from dodgy degrees. Governments should help them

_metadata.title: Electric grids - Sources and acknowledgments | Technology Quarterly | The Economist
_metadata.headline: Sources and acknowledgments
author: The Economist
_metadata.articleBody:
As well as those named in this report, the author wishes to thank: Janusz Bialek, Jocelyn Chang, Mikey Clark, Julie Cohn, Danielle Dominey-Kent, Per Falborg, Will Gardiner, Connor Gary, Richard Hanson, Devin Hartman, Bruce Heppenstall, Christina Huemmer, Mike James, Suriya Jayanti, Fahimeh Kazempour, Aidan Kerr, Daniel Kirschen, Sara Revell, Rebecca Sedler and Solveig Wright
Read/watch list:
When the Grid Was the Grid: The History of North America’s Brief Coast-to-Coast Interconnected Machine (Julie Cohn)  
IGBT: From Invention and Commercialisation to Global Social Impact (Jayant Baliga)
The Indian Ministry of Power annual report is a fascinating picture of a grid in an incredible state of flux  
Amprion’s report for 2022 shows a developed country’s grid 
Mesoscale modelling of a “Dunkelflaute” event 
Achieving a 100% Renewable Grid: Operating Electric Power Systems with Extremely High Levels of Variable Renewable Energy
